net.xuset.objectIO.connections

Class StreamConReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.StreamCon
      • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.StreamConReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection, StreamConI, MsgParsable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TcpCon

    public class StreamConReader
extends StreamCon
    This class continually monitors the input stream for new data. Once new data is available it is parsed and added to the message queue. This is different form the StreamCon class in that StreamCon only reads from the InputStream when it is needed.

    StreamCon.attemptToReadRawMessage() is continually called from a separate thread until reachedEndOfInput() is true. So if you extend this class and override attemptToReadRawMessage() or handleRawInput(String), make sure those two methods are thread safe.

    The method #addMsgToQueue(MarkupMsg) is thread safe.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • StreamConReader

        public StreamConReader(java.io.InputStream in,
               long id)
        Constructs a new StreamConReader object with the supplied InputStream and id. Using this constructor will disable sending messages because no OutputStream was supplied.
        Parameters:
        in - InputStream to read data from
        id - the id of the connection

      • StreamConReader

        public StreamConReader(java.io.InputStream in,
               java.io.OutputStream out,
               long id)
        Constructs a new StreamConReader object with the given I/O streams and id. Since both an InputStream and OutputStream is given, sending and receiving messages is enabled.
        Parameters:
        in - InputStream to receive messages
        out - OutputStream to send messages
        id - the id of the connection

    • Method Detail

      • pollNextMsg

        public MarkupMsg pollNextMsg()
        Polls the next message in the received messages queue. The message is removed and returned.
        Specified by:
        pollNextMsg in interface Connection
        Overrides:
        pollNextMsg in class StreamCon
        Returns:
        the next available MarkupMsg or null if there are no messages to poll

      • isMsgAvailable

        public boolean isMsgAvailable()
        Indicates if the received messages queue has messages stored. If this method returns true, the messages can be read by calling pollNextMsg().
        Specified by:
        isMsgAvailable in interface Connection
        Overrides:
        isMsgAvailable in class StreamCon
        Returns:
        true if a message can be polled by pollNextMsg()

      • addMsgToQueue

        protected boolean addMsgToQueue(MarkupMsg msg)
        Description copied from class: StreamCon
        Adds a message to the received messages queue. The added messages can be read by calling pollNextMsg()
        Overrides:
        addMsgToQueue in class StreamCon
        Parameters:
        msg - message to add to the received message queue
        Returns:
        This method never fails at adding the message and will always return true.
